I think this bodes really well for the quality of the CSS, that this result can reasonably be achieved just by tweaking things in the dev tools, presumably without totally rewriting huge amounts of CSS. From this, it seems eventually possible to tweak the standard appearance and even allow some customization, like the background image. I really like the opacity effects (we'd want to keep an eye on keeping contrast high enough).
The bg image idea is cool, maybe we can provide that in personal setting so that user can select the bg by its own taste
yep, it's a few lines at most... and whilst messing about I think I may have had some ideas about how to move the scroll bar to the middle panel. (which has been a confusing issue).

What if we had something like a "community themes" tab with some of these themes?
I really like the css shared in the OP in this topic, having an option to easily use that would be really cool.

https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/ideas.20for.20a.20new.20theme/near/839923 mentions stylus as something we could rely on to create a set of community themes... but personally I'd prefer something from our end which could showcase and one click apply... idk. some reasons were mentioned there, I believe.
The issue is we would need to maintain every one of the themes we decide to support. Look at how many minor things slip through when we just have a light and a dark theme to test.
Yeah, and usually when you developing you don't care about supporting all the themes, and then slowly they grow obsolete and get thrown away. You can ask ZT folks how difficult it is to manage them.
